title: Prepare for 0.7.0-rc1
body: Fixes #302. Fixes #306. Fixes #307. Fixes #310.

title: Rename the refuse stale policy to reject.
body: Refuse sounds wrong. Not sure what I was thinking!

title: Check manifest hashes of CRLs.
body: Fixes #265.

title: Add server and stale object metrics.
body: Fixes #232. Fixes #179.

title: Don’t panic if RTR or HTTP listener addresses are empty.
body: No Changelog necessary since this fixes newly added code.

title: Consolidate ROA information kept and enable csvext in HTTP server.
body:
This PR seems to bring memory consumption down to a quarter of what we used to use.

Fixes #269.

title: Add filtering of dubious host names in URIs.
body: Fixes #267.

title: New output format compatcsv for more compatibility.
Allow defining explicit names for TALs.
body: Fixes #271.

title: Add bird and bird2 compatible output format.
body: This continues from #273. Fixes #272.

title: Shorten synopsis of man page.
body:
This only shows the most relevant option for each command and otherwise merely points out that there are more options available.

This would fix #281 and probably more similar issues.

title: Introduce a policy for dealing with stale objects.
body: Fixes #274.

title: Adjust to changes in rpki-rtr.
VrpStore got renamed to VrpSource and VrpTarget.
Remove use of derive_more and unwrap.
Queue CAs for processing when their repo isn’t current yet.
Downgrade to requiring Rust 1.39.
body: This so we can use Alpine 3.11 for Docker builds.

title: Update to Tokio 2.0 and async functions all around.
body: This is limited to the RTR and HTTP servers. Repository synchronization and validation remain synchronous atop a thread pool.

title: Remove native TLS Docker image.
body: As discussed with @partim, native TLS is available to those who want to build support for it but the only user of the native TLS image known to date can address their use case via the existing Routinator support for specifying a custom CA cert. If we merge this to master we should **first** disable the build rule at Docker Hub. We could also optionally move `Dockerfile` back to the `/` and remove the then empty `docker` subdirectory, which would also require editing the build rule at Docker Hub to find the `Dockerfile` in the right place.

title: Enable support for CTRL-C from outside the container.
body:
Fixes #257. See https://github.com/krallin/tini for Tini documentation.
The "proper" fix is to handle the signal sent to the process, though Tini also handles other "pid 1" responsibilities as well (e.g. reaping finished background processes).

title: Add rsync and C toolchain to Quick Start
body:
This PR changes the README so that it no longer assumes you have a machine with rsync and the C Toolchain already installed, but starts from a clean Debian / Ubuntu install. It also introduces the new command for installing Rust. 

Lastly, the instruction now also update Rust before updating Routinator.

title: bump alpine to 3.11.3 (rust 1.39) in Dockerfile
body: Bump alpine to 3.11.3 which brings with it newer Rust. Manually validated.

title: routinator.service: restart the daemon on failure
body:
RestartSec was a forgotten statement used while debugging: we actually
want the daemon to be restarted on failure.

title: Fix description in prometheus endpoint
body: Nitpick: In the prometheus endpoint the description of the RRDP duration words it as rsync duration.

title: Disable apk caching to reduce image size
body: Avoid storing ~1.4M of /var/cache/apk/ files in the image which are not needed. Pkg installation still works without them.

title: Compile-time TLS library selection.
body:
Based on the existing `tls-via-features` branch but with `master` merged in, `Dockerfile` updated and `Cargo.lock` regenerated (by `cargo build --release`).

"Tested' with default features via the Docker build, connecting to Krill v0.4.2-pre via NGINX with a custom CA certificate, which wasn't possible with stock Routinator.

Before:
```
$ routinator -vvv vrps -o output.json -f json --complete
https://nginx/ta/ta.cer: https://nginx/ta/ta.cer: error trying to connect: invalid certificate: UnknownIssuer
```

After:
```
RRDP: Known server https://nginx/rrdp/notification.xml at /home/routinator/.rpki-cache/repository/rrdp/2902116796
Found valid trust anchor https://nginx/ta/ta.cer. Processing.
RRDP https://nginx/rrdp/notification.xml: Updating server
Serials: us 1, them 1
RRDP https://nginx/rrdp/notification.xml: Delta update succeeded.

```

title: Use a Docker volume instead of a host filesystem directory to store TALs.
body: This avoids having to fiddle with host permissions.

title: Prepare for release 0.6.4.
Use signal_hook’s tokio-support feature directly.
body: This should fix Routinator occasionally getting completely stuck.

title: Release 0.6.3
Forcefully terminate the server on fatal error.
Delay creating of the HTTP client until after a possible fork.
body: This will make RRDP to actually work in detached server mode (aka `server -d`). Fixes #246.

title: Typo correction: descrined -> described
Fix spelling in routinator_rrdp_duration metrics definition.
body: Fixes #247.

title: Prepare for release 0.6.2.
Format time values in RPSL with a stable length.
body: Fixes the RPSL output via the HTTP endpoint.

title: bump docker alpine to 3.10.3
body: Bump the Dockerfile to the latest stable version of Alpine Linux as base. Manually validated.

title: Reload TALs on SIGHUP
body:
This PR is a first attempt at handling SIGHUP (referencing #200) using crossbeam channels and `signal-hook`, which seems to be the current best practice. It allows us to get rid of `IdleWait`, which is nice. I’m not sure whether the threading model was what you were thinking of, which is why I only added the SIGHUP handler for now (though extending it should be fairly simple now!).

Let me know whether this is going in the right direction!

Cheers

title: use cmp where applicable
body:
This PR tries to fix the errors emitted by clippy, as promised in #239.

Cheers

repositry -> repository

Try creating parent directories before moving a published delta file.
Silence debug log from tokio, hyper, request, and h2.
